title: We Have Set a Great Big Goal: Nothing. - Honda Newsroom
summary: The article discusses Honda's recent initiatives aimed at achieving carbon neutrality by 2050, including the opening of a new EV battery plant and a collaboration for recycled battery materials. It highlights the company's Triple Action to Zero approach, which focuses on using clean energy, recycling materials, and promoting hydrogen fuel cell technology. Honda aims to have 100% of new vehicle sales be battery or fuel cell electric by 2040 while maintaining a sustainable business model. The initiatives demonstrate Honda's commitment to reducing environmental impacts through innovative practices.

title: Boom Supersonic and Dimensional Energy Announce Sustainable Aviation Fuel Offtake Agreement USA - English - PR Newswire
summary: Boom Supersonic has announced a purchase agreement for 5 million gallons of sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) per year from Dimensional Energy, thereby furthering their commitment to net-zero carbon emissions. The SAF is produced using carbon neutral methods that recycle carbon dioxide. This collaboration aims to facilitate the development of a supersonic airliner, Overture, which will fly using 100% SAF. The efforts are part of Boom's broader sustainability goals, including achieving net-zero carbon by 2025.

title: We Can’t Manage Cattle Methane Without… - Breakthrough Institute
summary: The article discusses the increasing global efforts to reduce methane emissions, particularly from livestock, in light of climate change goals. It emphasizes the importance of accurate measurement technology for enteric methane emissions to achieve reduction targets and highlights existing challenges in research and data collection. Funding for methane research is critically needed, but current investment levels fall significantly short of what is deemed necessary. Collaboration among researchers, industry, and government is essential to build capacity, improve methodologies, and support innovation for effective emissions reduction.

summary: The SUBMARINER Network has launched the AlgaeProBANOS project, funded by the EU's Horizon Europe programme, to promote a carbon-neutral and circular blue economy using algae. title: Dow and New Energy Blue announce collaboration to develop renewable plastic materials from corn residue - PR Newswire
summary: Dow and New Energy Blue have entered a long-term supply agreement to produce bio-based ethylene from renewable agricultural residues, such as corn stover, for the production of renewable plastics. This collaboration aims to reduce carbon emissions from plastic production and supports the development of a circular economy for agricultural waste. Their agreement is expected to displace over one million tons of greenhouse gas emissions annually and provide local farmers with a reliable market for their agricultural residues. This initiative aligns with Dow's sustainability goals and enhances the use of renewable resources in their products.

title: Why This CEO Says Plant-Based Meat Is a Lot Like Electric Cars - VegNews
summary: Alexandre Ruberti, CEO of Future Farm, compares the growth potential of the plant-based meat market to that of electric cars, noting that like any new market, it will experience fluctuations before stabilizing. title: Asda lists British vodka brand in 50 Yorkshire stores - Grocery Gazette
summary: Asda is introducing Dutch Barn Orchard Vodka, made from British apples, in 50 stores across Yorkshire. This vodka brand, produced by Ellers Farm Distillery, focuses on sustainability and has been carbon neutral since its inception, using brown glass bottles with a high percentage of recycled glass. The product's launch is part of Asda's commitment to supporting local suppliers and enhancing their range of local products.
green_innovation: TRUE - The product demonstrates commitment to sustainability by being carbon neutral and using recycled materials, which reduces its environmental impact.
business_innovation: TRUE - The introduction of Dutch Barn Orchard Vodka represents a new and improved product that differs significantly from other vodka offerings, emphasizing sustainable practices.

green_process: TRUE - The vodka production process incorporates sustainability measures such as being carbon neutral and utilizing recycled glass, minimizing environmental impacts.

greenwashing: FALSE - The article provides credible information about the sustainable practices of Dutch Barn Orchard Vodka and does not appear to make misleading claims about its environmental benefits.
